												So i bought this game a long time ago, back when GFWL was still active. I never got around to playing it though as many other games seemed to be getting better press and reviews. Also didnt help that the community was raging about a poor port job, graphics, controls. So anyway i downloaded the DSFix so i could play at a glorious 60fps and commenced my playthrough. The tutorial area ? Lets call it that didnt really impress me and i started to think this was just some generic rpg like Drakensang or suchlike. So i continued fought my way through the Undead Burg, crossed into the Parish (by this time i was addicted) and died so many times and drank far too much coffee in the meantime. Suddenly though i started to notice little things, other players were leaving hints...tips to get through the game. Words of encouragement were welcome as there were times i had almost enough. I fought my way through started killing off powerful beings with Lord Souls (having no clue yet what the outcome was) struggling to give my undead knight some peace. Battle after battle, death after death and finally i stood before a fog wall ready to do battle with the Lord of Cinder. He fell and i joined the fire and all was good for the undead or was it?.. My final thoughts on the game as i watched the credits were mixed. In a way i was glad that the ordeal was over but still i felt that i would miss it..prompting me to start over . Praise the Sun.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												So this game came up on the Steam Winter Sale, and at the price point I thought it worth checking out. I had, after all, heard so much about its bone-crushing difficulty and ridiculous levels of '♥♥♥♥ you, player' that I couldn't help but to be intrigued. There had to be something to it, right?So I bought it, installed it, installed the resolution fixes, added mouse capability to it, and started playing.That is when I discovered that Dark Souls is not a 'hard' game. It is simply unforgiving.The last few years of gaming had trained me to be lazy and dare I say entitled. To regenerating health, hand-holding, steamroller protagonists, all the various watered down populist ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t that has been focus-tested and brute-forced through the mainstream system. Dark Souls stripped all that away without telling me, and I have to say that at first I was furious. How was the starting area enemy such a threat, and why did he remain a threat hours into the game? Losing resources for good due to a single mistake? No map or guidance on where to go or what to do? No teleport pads? What the hell kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t was all this?Then, I had a realization. Those things happened because of me. My mistake. My haste, my lack of care, my poor choice of equipment, whatever. It wasn't because the AI was cheating like a rubberband racer, or a glitch in the game - it all came down to my decisions, for good or for ill. Dark Souls didn't just hand me success, or elevate me without merit, but instead challenged me to rise to the occasion. In that challenge, I found a real sense of triumph in a game that I haven't felt in some time.In a way, this is because Dark Souls puts the PC on much the same or lesser footing than the NPCs. Even the weakest of them can kill a PC in a few combos, even when the PC can one-shot them. There are many more of them, and they coordinate, with the same toolbox of weapons and attacks that the PC has. The only advantages the PC has are the minor improvements to his stats and equipment, which can never make him invincible, and the human judgement behind its actions. Dark Souls demands that the player learn to succeed.Suffice it to say, I am a fan.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 12, 2014
												I don't do many reviews, but by the amount of hours I have for this game, I hope you can tell that this is probably my favourite game of all time.The reason.It's a game that can seem impossibly unfair at first, but in reality asks you to learn it's nuances and then challenge yourself to improve and take ememies on in different ways. Initially you become aware of the possibility of taking "some" eneimies out without getting close enough for them to take an interest in you using the bow and arrow. I won't say where, that is for the player to find out. But then I decided that that was the wimps way out, and proposed to take these enemies on in hand to hand combat. The result, I died, then I died again. But eventually you learn and defeating the enemie becomes almost second nature. So you proceed deeper into the game and the learning process begins again.The same is true of the boss fights. Initially they can seem overwhelming, but as you learn, you get better. It helps that you can summon other players to help you in these battles, providing the summoning signs are there and you haven't been invaded in "human" form. Invasions can be a bugbear, as there can be many players who will seem overpowered. Some have definitely been cheating. But a lot of invasions have a code of conduct. I was invaded, but the player allowed me to clear the game enemies, before pwning me royally. Part of the code is an unspoken agreement not to quaff from your estus flask or use other items to restore your health. Did I mention I suck at PVP though.The whole game feels as part of a whole. The levels are interlinked, with shortcuts opening up back to previous areas as you progress deeper and deeper into the game. The faults with the game.The default graphics and keyboard/mouse settings. Because I kinew the DSFix mod from Durante was out there I made use of that from the outset to enjoy the game in HD. This has been further improved with the addition of mods, that DSFix enable you to use in the game. I have never had a problem using an XBox 360 Controller, so I have not had much experience with Keyboard and mouse in this game. I would argue though that the game demands the use of a controller. Some of the animations felt clunky. Watch some of the enemies jumping and you will see what I mean. The biggest "fault" with the game is that once it has sunk it claws into you, it will not let you go. You know that the enemie that is stopping you from proceeding that bit further into the game can be beaten. If you are like me, you will die again and again. You may even walk away from a particular boss for a brief time only to come back to it. But as you get the moveset down, you will want to progress still deeper into the game.Overall I rate this game 9.5 out of 10. It isn't perfect, no game truly is, and it won't be everyones cup of tea, but I love the challenge it represents.

content:
Posted: January 25, 2014
												After so many hours in only one month - This game has become one of my favourites. So addicting, versatile and arrogating!This is what the gaming industry needs! A true hardcore game. Dark Souls wants you to explore and observate it's world and think before swinging your weapon - if you can't do that you'll fail terribly. I can't wait for Dark Souls 2, an even harder experience.+ Very challenging difficulty (Core-Gamer only)+ Authentic Atmosphere, Good Graphic-Style, Soundeffects and Soundtrack+ Tons of weapons/armors/items for individual playing style+ The game doesn't help you at all, you're alone+ Diversified boss fights+ Long playing time (A lot to explore, and a lot deaths (; )+ (Gamepad) Controlls are intuitional and very handy. The combat system wants you to think about every hit/dodge/block/counter you make. If your smashing buttons your stamina will soon be empty and you are sure to die.+ A few good Online Features (Coop)- Sometimes frustrating- Some glitches and clipping problems*- Unplayable with mouse and keyboard.*- I missed the DLC because I finished the game before doing it. (If you defeat the final boss the new game+ will start)- Graphics are outdated- Online Invaders can join your game with much higher level than you have...- Summon another player for Coop rarely works and if it works it makes the boss fights too easy and destroys the feeling of triumph.[ English is not my first language, so please excuse the typos and errors ]

content:
Posted: April 24, 2015
												Excellent game. I have enjoyed every hour (except those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ archers in Anor Londo) playing this game, almost every minute on the edge wondering what was gonna come around the next corner to take me out. I love the lore with this game in the sense you can theorize on a lot of things with other players in the community to piece the story or history behind the characters and environment. Sound is amazing with gripping parts in perfect moments and the voice actors are fantastic, especially at showing how the curse is slowly affecting them as you meet them thru the game. Graphics are not bad, especially if you do a nice mod on the textures, the game can look pretty damn amazing. Gameplay is really good as well, but i do not care for the platforming aspect of the game at all. As long as you are careful you will be ok but there will be times when you may just fall, or have some pretty terrible luck, inducing some good old fashion rage if you had a good chunk of souls or humanity on you. Spends souls wisely, but dont walk around with moneybags on your waist full of the stuff or you will seriously regret it if you die and then dont make it back to your bloodstain. This game is definitely not for everyone, and i can definitely agree as i did not care for the series at all. I am now hooked, weirdly playing them in reverse order, but still enjoying it nonetheless. I strongly recommend this game to anyone who wants a serious challenge with a good feeling of triumph and satisfaction when you topple that tough boss or pass thru that dungeon that handed you your♥♥♥♥♥a few times over.     Rating:   9.5/10!

content:
Posted: March 24, 2016
												Definately the best RPG trilogy out there, and now that the third one is coming along with Hidetaka Miyazaki directing it. I strongly  suggest that you start your journey without spoiling yourself about literally anything!, thats the beauty of it!, going at it with barely any info on the game and you slowly start to learn and discover the world with some of the most impressive level designs I've seen. Yes you will suffer alot, but know this, there is no artificial difficulty here, simply your thinking and how you will over come the tasks ahead. Whoever says the game is too difficult are simply not playing it right, surely there are no tutorials that pop up in your face every five minutes, so you'll have to learn most of the the mechanics on your own. This game will change the way you look at bosses and how you fight them, and the euphoric moment when you overcome a boss/challenge you couldn't accomplish before is fantastic. Great gameplay mechanics and a beautiful deep story in a gorgeous world with lovely/hateful characters with their own stories to tell. 9.7/10 probably the best game I've ever played,and I don't think anything can top this series.GO ON AND PLAY IT!

content:
Posted: August 27, 2012
												This game has it's shortcomings: some of the combat can feel wonky at first, some of the level meshes can cause you to fall where you feel you shouldn't and sometimes you plain don't know what happened there.That said, the world looks amazing, the monsters legitemately scare me (because they WILL kill you) and the game rewards you for moments where you play well.The game is also tough as nails. I've died more often in this game then I have in any other game I can remember, and I've only played it for 12 hours at this point. However, whereas the deaths felt infuriating and gut wrenching at first, this feeling later got replaced with a sense of challenge; even when you die (which you will, a lot), you usually have a chance to regain what you've lost, and even when you can't it's not a huge deal. TL;DR: If you like a challenge and you have enough patience to get used to the unique nature of the game, you'll find a lot of fun and a hell of a lot of challenge in this game.

content:
Posted: April 28, 2015
												Mhmm, where to begin? I love this game what can I say? If its not brutal difficuilty or amazingly tight controls (controller) then its the PvP! With around 3k hours in it (over all consoles) I've enjoyed this game so much It's hard to put into words so lets try! Lets start with the story, The actual plot is self is not too interesting at least in my opinion but with all the lore you find and /or figure out on your own  the story you build is one to be remembered. but for a summary, "You're undead and are the "chosen undead" so basically you go to the "land of acient lords" to rings some bells. All the small details in this game are just great.  Sorry I don't have much to say on the story, It's fine but the actual plot like I said is alright at best, the lore behind said plot is amazing. Read into it! You will not be sorry. Oh, as a note the game goes for a very lonely feeling, and it nails it very well. Characters come and go. So, Dark souls is know for its "brutal difficuilty" as I noted before, while I stand by that the game is hard they're FAR harder games out there, though this game does give a good challenge. The gameplay Dark souls  is a action rpg though the rpg mechanics for me at least was only really in the leveling, It has a tight control scheme that is focued around sword/shield play and spells, Every attack has a wind up time so you need to time attacks not to get hit while in the animation along with managing your stamina and health the game starts to create a amazing risk/reward system in the larger area's (Do I keep going or do I go back to the bonfire and spend my souls level up etc.  Besides this there are a large selection of weapon classes and a good number of weapons, Though almost every weapon in a weapon class has the same Light attack almost every weapon has a different heavy attack (though some are complete clones) as well as a good seletion of armor you can make your character look as you please! There is also a decently large amount of  spells for your choosing. I don't have an overall  a lot to say for the spells.Now, for the games music,  Though the type of music I would never listen to much in my spare time it's amazing for the game! It just gets your heart pumping  since music only plays during bosses and two area's. The music is very intense unless you're listening to one of the actual area sound tracks which have the perfect level of somberness to them.   Ashe lake theme is just amazing  The game has over all pretty good netcode though actually getting into the games of the people you want can be pretty hard. And PvP is not overally active anymore (sadly)  at least on pc.  I find it VERY hard to to give this game a number It's just too personal so well I'm not going too. Though I should say one chain of areas are very low quaility compaired to the rest of the game  and it was clearly rushed. Besides that make sure you get DSFIX to make the game run like a decent game. Oh, and a controller is nice because keyboard/mouse in my opinion is god awful.  I would still recomend this game. Though if you want the game to be a little easier just have some patience and take your time it will really help. Thanks for reading! I hope you have even a quarter the fun in this game as I do because you'll be loving it for years to come. I hope you all have a great day. As always please say if I need to fix something/complaints in the comments, if you would want to watch me play games  you can watch me over all www.twitch.tv/mrfirestorm

content:
Posted: January 7
												Dark Souls 1 is probably the best game I have ever played on the PC platform. It is expertly crafted in that the game doesn't hold hands with you, but makes you learn the inner workings through the level design. And this is truly where Dark Souls shines. Each area in Dark Souls connects to others in such a compact way that it is spatially synced to the overworld. The player will find shortcuts which will lead back to a previous area they found. Not to mention the nonlinear path that a player can take. Once you finish the tutorial, you already have the choice of going two ways, and if you picked up the Master Key, you can even take a third path. If you're itching for some epic boss battles, Dark Souls has nothing but the best. Unfortunately, a negative side of this version on Steam is that it is not optimized well at all, and this could be a make or break for many people who are wanting to play this game. Other than that, this game is fantastic.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												Dark Souls is the perfect mix of old-school Japanese game design with Western RPG mechanics.It's a love letter to a time when games challenged you, demanded you to make a damned effort; and then rewarded you handsomely with an overwhelming, addictive sense of accomplishment.It's a no-nonsense, pure gameplay game. There are barely any cutscenes. The story (which is rather deep and nicely layered) is told in minute pieces you need to pick up and put together on your own. There are a handful of spoken lines and there's not even any form of lipsynch --every resource was devoted to the *game* part of the game.In a time when everyone goes for the everything-and-the-kitchen-sink school of game design, Dark Souls takes a theme and a gameplay mechanic, and decides to just focus on that. Instead of trying to implement 15 different kinds of games at once and half-assing them all (at best), Dark Souls simply aims to be a game about hitting skeletons with a sword --but then it sets out to be the deepest, most complex title on the subject.The world is large, interconnected, it offers a myriad of ways to go about it, it holds gigantic secret areas, and it just drips with atmosphere. In a whole bunch on non-trivial ways, Dark Souls might just be the one true metroidvania of the 21st century.Dark Souls is one of those things that will be talked about in gaming history books.Do I recommend this game? There is no "thumbs up" big enough \[T]/

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 29, 2012
												THIS GAME HAS GRAND AND BEAUTIFUL SCENERY (love those environments), AS WELL AS VERY DETAILED AND AMAZING ARTWORK (shout out to that monster art), ALL WRAPPED UP INTO A VAST AND GRITTY STYLED WORLD THAT CONTAINS THE STUFF OF LEGENDS (Hydras, dragons, basalisks, giant clams with tiny legs & hidden lore are included).Many people hate this game, say its impossible & there's nothing worth a look. 'They' probably have anger management problems and no patience. The game starts in a cage, they die, get angry, die faster and more frequently-seeing nothing but stone walls and dangerous enemies at first, they soon rage and quit."If you try it you might like it""But i tried it mama!""Did you really try it? Or did you just eat the slightly burnt crust of THAT GODLIKE PIZZA BAKED BY ODINS VALKYRIES THEMSELVES?!?!?""GET SOME HAIR ON YOUR CHEST BOY!!!!!" your mother screams like a drill instructor & slaps uYou will see grand scenery, you will reap treasure beyond imagining, you will FEEL the reward!But only after you trawl through sewers, slay the dealiest enemies, hunt the strangest of creatures, defend yourself from disgusting abominations, to scour the world.This game rewards those who keep cool under pressure & persevere. Get angry, then u get reckless & then you die being reckless. Be smart, learn to properly utilize your arsenal (which can be massive), learn different techniques and tactics, attack effectively and counter appropriately-you'll be the victor. Different weapons and/or different approaches all have their strengths & weaknesses depending upon the situation.THE GRITIf you make a mistake & don't die, then it's a good outcome.If you don't look for openings and attack immediately instead, the enemy may do the same, so you both stab each other & die clutching your stomach-assuming the enemy doesn't have armour enough to endure your hit that is.If you dodge a heavy weapon, before it's lifted back up you can stab that insolent fool in the back if your fast enough-but if you don't dodge it... Your body will be pulverized into the ground.However adept you become, a single mistake or a single random occurence that catches you off-guard, can mean your death.THE PVP & CO-OP IS VERY GOODAlthough there are a few bugs-like the small online delay when receving backstabs from other players (which there are quite a few methods to prevent), it is fairly balanced (there are a few exceptions that are unfairly harder to counter then others to the extreme, but there are ways).I MUST STRESSThat if you like a proper challenge, a first playthrough while summoning phantoms to help may spoil your experience & transform u into a dependant cherub.There are optional areas & hidden weapons-don't miss em! The Great Hollow is a favourite of mine.Bare chest & WARRIOR class for versatity is recommended IMO. 16 strength and 12-14 dexterity for great weapon choice and range.Unless u wanna crush things, then go BANDIT.26-28 strength for 99% of your enemy crushing needs.Barechest is no longer recommended, but rather a necessity.Sorcerer for easier mode, the class starts off wth lazors.25 minimum intelligence to rub crystals on your weapons.Wear a skirt.But if you wanna be a baus, but you also want to fire your lazors, then complete the game without increasing vitality or endurance.

												10/10 would praise the sunFirst of all, you will die, there's no way around it and without help you will die a multitude of times. Yes, you will get mad. Yes, you will want to punch a hole through your screen. This is all on solo with no guides. I know because I used to feel the same ways. BUT when you do complete boss levels, certain goals and parts you were stuck on you tend to get such an amazing sense of accomplisment and relief, only then to die again of course. However, these things will not come easily so don't think they will, unlike other games, the storyline and objectives aren't handed to you on a silver plate; in fact you get roughly one decent hint about objectives in the game made by directors. The other hints all come from messages on the ground which means you'll have to trust in the "kindness" of other, be scrupulous don't trust messages as some are indeed trolls. The storyline is also immensely deep and you really have to search for clues, the reason it's not too clear is because the creators wanted each person to imagine it in their own way but there is a wiki which displays what the storylines main ideas are if you want to use that.Basically, yes I recommend this game and will continue to recommend this game. Forever. This is one of the only games that I enjoy replaying over and Over and OVER again not only on New Game+ but with new characters.Although, bear in mind, this game is far from perfect in the eyes of others. There are graphical fixes and online fixes if you want to play with your friends, here is the link...if you do this, follow the instructions CAREFULLY, when I did this I messed up STEP 3 as I editted the wrong file:http://steamcommunity.com/app/211420/discussions/0/828935269278734403/Also, if you plan on using the keyboard I WISH YOU THE MOST LUCK as this was rushed for pc porting as the developers really only assumed it would be wanted on console so therefore made a crappy PC port, so to get the full experience use a controller and a gamepad. Good luck and PRAISE THE SUN!

content:
Posted: December 22, 2012
												If you have never played this game and own a PS3 the nshame on you. If you have never played this game and own a PC then I understand. The PC port has been surronded with negative reception and quips about it's quality. Allow me to distill those fears. With a dedicated resolution fix that is constantly updating and even a FPS unlocker the technical issues that plague this game are basically fixed. If you own a wired controller than the controls won't be an issue and I myself beat the whole game with KB+M with little problem (hint: get used to the controls and adapt). There, port problems fixed. Now you can enjoy one of the best games of the last decade. In a world chock full of vistas and hollows dripping with detail and atmoshpere, your skill determines thew outcome of a seemingly hopeless battle waged against fantastical enemies. Loads of weapons, armor sets, and spells keep replayability fresh with multiple character builds. Combat is polished and tense with each encounter keeping you on your toes. If the challenge puts you off, persevere! This game is one of the most rewarding experiences in gaming if you can claim to master it. Of course, along with the fantastic base game you also get the recently released DLC with adds hours more of content and a some fantastic boss fights. Buy it now and PRAISE THE SUN!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 7, 2013
												What to say about Dark Souls...Dark Souls is amazing in every way. The gameplay, the story, the lore, and the atmosphere. The atmosphere plays a huge roll in Dark Souls, making you feel alone and hopeless through much of the game, considering that almost everyone around you is going insane. Dark Souls has a very original way of intergrating multiplayer into the singleplayer. Around the land of Lordran, you will find these Humanity Sprites. With Humanity, you have the ability to become "Human". When you become "Human", You are able to summon other players by finding their White Soapstone. This allows you to engage in jolly cooperation! However, be warned. Becoming "Human" makes you suspectible to invasions. Invasions are random, and are forced upon you. The invaders sole purpose is to hunt you down and kill you for your humanity, so be cautious whenever you get invaded! Hands down, Dark Souls is one of the best games of 2011-2013, and it has shown it's worth the phrase "Prepare to Die".

												Gloriously fun, unique, and at times difficult rpg. Great storyline along with many hours of gameplay and replay-ability, Play the game more or less however you want. content:
Posted: March 11, 2016
												Dark Souls still remains my all time favorite game.And no, this game isnt hard. As long as you dont try something, fail at the strategy you used, then try it again and again and again 1235435 times. If it doesnt work, try a different strategy. For the most part, its pretty balanced. The only thing they didnt nerf and shouldve nerfed was ♥♥♥♥in wrath of the gods. It stuns most builds, and people are allowed to spam it in PvP, because thats how the spell works. Even with decent armor on, it still takes chunks out of my life. Anyways, everything else is pretty good. Theres so much weapon variety, and nearly every weapon has its own moveset. They all have different attack properties. One sword may have normal attack, and piercing. A scimitar has slashing damage. A rapier has piercing. A mace will have blunt/strike damage. A spiked mace will do piercing damage. And every armor has different strengths and weaknesses to each of these attack properties. Typically lighter armored enemies are weaker to slash damage, most heavy armored enemies are weaker to piercing. I like all this depth because not many RPG games even have this sort of thing thought out. A mace may do the same type of damage as a curved sword, or a dagger used for thrusting. Theres also 3 different types of magic you can add to your character. Pyromancy, which is kinda close range magic. Sorcery, which is more long range. And then theres Clerics. People also do 3 typical different types of weapon builds:Dexterity, strength, and "quality". No, it doesnt mean its a real quality build.Dexterity is typically for character builds to use fast, quick attacking weapons.Strength for the heavy hitters, typically the slower weaponsQuality is used for people who want both.Now take all these different build possibilities, and you get a♥♥♥♥♥♥ton of replay value. Theres also the many many different weapons to expirement with, and different upgrading paths to expirement with. The story isnt presented like most games are today. With fancy cutscenes, dialogue, etc. A lot of it is through lore. Lore that you must piece together yourself through reading and speculation. If you're too lazy like me, there are many lore videos going over everything.Yes, this game was an extremely lazy port by FromSoft, its evident with the optimization issues and the xbox buttons being displayed for actions.Without mods, this only runs at 30 FPS. But honestly, it looks fine. Not as fluid as other games running at 60 FPS, but you get used to it.

content:
Posted: March 13, 2016
												Ah.. Dark Souls.. You have given me my highest and lowest times in my gaming history. With every moment of joy, you will punish me in ways I never knew could happen. After finally killing that boss.. to being pushed off a cliff by a weak hollow.You will get angry, you will die but you will push on.Dark Souls drops you off into a strange land with very little to go on and sends you on your way. The open world allows you to wander into areas far beyond your skill but as you master the game these areas will allow you to choose how you tackle the start of the game in new and challenging ways.The depth of the story is a bit hard to take in on your first few playthroughs but as you listen more and more you will start to see the world unfold before you.The npcs add a nice and manic flare to the atmosphere, often mocking you or giving you vague information on what you could be doing next. They don't treat you like a hero, you are just some other hollow, passing through, like the rest of them.The amount of gear you can aquire allows for very unique character development and style choice  Meta aside , making it so no 2 characters are the same.This is one of the best games I have ever played and I would recommend it to anyone who is willing to take a hit to their ego.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												"Dark Souls" is challenging yet highly rewarding when the challenges are overcome. The land of Lordran is a fantastic and beautiful world with a rich story driven by the sparse dialogue and lore hidden in item descriptions. Unfortunately, the PC version was a first attempt at PC games for From Software and, as such, a few elements suffered. The modding community made quick fixes of all the problems, however, and all are readily available at the Dark Souls Nexus. (http://www.nexusmods.com/darksouls/) [DSfix is a must and I highly recommend the High-Res UI and Subtitle fonts, ORIGINAL - PlayStation3 button icon textures (if you are using a PS3 controller with MotionInJoy), and Lowest Common Denominator HD Textures!]"Dark Souls" on PC does have a problem with other players utilizing hacks and trainers as well as requiring Games for Windows Live to play online. If those two issues are a deal-breaker then pick up the PS3 version (or Xbox360 edition if you are homosexual... "not that there's anything wrong with that").Some people do use a mouse and keyboard to play this game, but a controller of some sort makes gameplay much better in my estimation. It is one of the few games where the mouse and keyboard really give no advantage. Xbox controllers work natively and PS3 controllers can be used via a program called MotionInJoy.Definitely one of my favorite games of the past decade; I highly recommend this game. Also, do yourself a favor and LOOK UP NOTHING. Play the game blind, at least for your first run.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												This game is probably on of the hardest games I've played in a while. It will make you rip your hair out and want to shut off your computer. Dark Souls forces you to pay FULL attention to everything you do in the game. Any lapse in focus will result in the loss of health, or more likely, death. Every enemy you face in the game is a challenge and requires strategy in order to beat. Luckily, you are able to summon other players in game that can help you during the harder boss fights. Unfortunately, you also open yourself up to "Invaders" who are players that come into your game with the sole purpose to rip you a new♥♥♥♥♥hole. I must admit, the first time it happened, I yelled at my screen "WHY ARE YOU SO MEAN!?", as the Invader killed me, sending me back through hours of work... but I digress. The enemy designs in this game are a breath of fresh air and a great change of pace. There are so many different enemy designs which are memorable and inspired. Another thing I love about Dark Souls, is the level of free reign and depth to the game. There are many different side quests which you can follow instead of following the main story line. The combat system in the game is very fun, yet difficult, to use. There are enough different weapons in the game to make your head spin. From claymores to halbreds, or even a pretty in depth magic system, you can pretty much get through the game with almost any weapon you want. It's not so much the power of the weapon, but the skill level of your character and the skill level of the gamer. You can have a huge♥♥♥♥♥sword with 900 power, but if your hero has the strenth of a 5-year-old, your hero will stumble as they try to swing the weapon.Dark Souls is by far one of my favorite games of all time. All of the different systems, weapons, and enemies, will make any playthrough fun and enjoyable. It also doesn't hold your hand like many games today. It drops you into hell and says "Do it ♥♥♥♥♥!", forcing you to learn and become good at the game by yourself. I'd DEFINITELY recomend this game. 9/10~~~NOTE~~~~~- An Xbox game pad or equivalent is basically a MUST- Download the graphical patches for PC to get the most out of the graphics

content:
Posted: February 12, 2014
												Dark Souls is perfect for anyone feeling like games these days are too easy, or that they hold your hand too much instead of letting you figure out and explore things yourself. The game addresses this issue by making a challenging, but fair, experience. As if the subtitle of the special edition wasn't apparent enough, you have probably figured out that you will die in this game. A lot. The casual gamer would give up and quit, but the determined gamer will pick themselves up and try new strategies to figure out how to defeat the world's many interesting and dangerous foes. This is where the game really shines (Praise the Sun!). The greatest reward the player can get from the game is overcoming the challenges contained within. On top of that, there is plenty of reason to play through the game a second time...and a third...and a fourth. Different character builds, weapons, spells, optional bosses to defeat, plus lots of other intricacies that can only be experienced by playing more than once through are what increase the longevity of this game even more - after the 50+ hours it will take you to complete the main "quest", that is. In short - Dark Souls is not a game for everyone, but if you are looking for a challenge and are a determined gamer, you will get one of the greatest experiences that video games have to offer right now.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 11, 2013
												Mechanics: Mysterious at first but once you figure them out you can become unstopable. Parrying and backstabs are essential to success but it felt like you needed to rely to much on them. The combat is fluid, the difficulty is good, and the areas are amazing.Story: It's story isn't clear yet it is amazing. The game tells you the premise and reason you are there and then lets you piece the rest out by your self. You will find characters that you will learn to love and help or learn to destroy and kill.Pacing: First you have your typical tutorial level but it isn't as easy as most tutorials. After that you are left in an open world and told to ring 2 bells. 1 above and another below. It's your decision to which to ring first though many chose the top side. After finding secrets, obtaining weapons, and hacking away at enemys you are met with a new boss to over come. Whether it be a demon or animal, you shall overcome it.Summary: The game is with flaws but they don't detract for what you will be expirencing. You shall face the invicible and the strong but they will not stop you from fulfilling your destiny. Just don't go hollow...PvP: I left this for last because it's extremly diffrent. In human form you may summon and get invaded by people. Being human gives you no real buffs except for summons. Having humanity in your counter though can give you some buffs like loot drop chance and curse resistance. Being human is both bad and good. You can get invaded by people 10+ of your level and some below your level. Some area, like the forest, have none to little PvP restrictions, so a 150 SL and invade a 120 SL. Covenants exist to enhance the PvP like the darkmoons (Police), Darkwraith (Hunter of humanity), Gravelords (MESS YOU UPers), and Forest Hunters (Guardians of the forest). What you use in PvE is used in PvP but some weapons are better for one or the other. When it comes to weapons it's really just what you like and succeed with. The PvP is fun and fast paced but has some problems with lag and gankers (People who summon 2 people who all gang up on an invader). You will occasionally encounter some of these problems but they are few and far between.9/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												I bought Dark Souls about a week ago, but I've been playing it a lot (I sometimes play in offline mode so my ingame hours won't be accurate). It's one of the best games I've ever played. Everyone talks about the difficulty, but the RPG stat system with attributes and weapon/armor stats is the best I've seen in any RPG. It is very difficult though with my special control setup, but it would be even worse with mouse and keyboard. I've heard Dark Souls 2 is playable with mouse and keyboard, but still easier with controller.I wasn't planning on getting the game mainly because of my hands, but also I wasn't sure if it would run on my PC which is why I watched Dark Souls on youtube a lot before buying it. I have had some issues with framerate, but I found out about a very popular mod called DSfix which can improve performance for low end PCs and for high end PCs it can increase framerate and improve various graphics. There's a guide on setting it up that I found helpful:


DSFIX - setup & basic configuration 
A Guide for Dark Souls: Prepare to Die Edition
By: sajtt (╭☞ ᗒ ▾ ᗕ )╭☞

			DSFIX		


I don't know what your gaming skills are like and if you're able to use a controller so it's hard to say whether I'd recommend the game. I've heard Dark Souls 2 is easier in general (in addition to being more playable with mouse and keyboard), but it's also more expensive and there's an HD version of DS2 coming out which will be even more expensive. If you do use mouse and keyboard be prepared to change all the bindings. I hear the default bindings are terrible. Dark Souls 1 sometimes goes on sale for $5.00 so it might be better to buy that to try it out. Especially if you think you're going to want the HD version of Dark Souls 2. There is a lot of information out there to make Dark Souls easier, but if your gaming skills are truly inept (especially if you can't use controllers) then no amount of walkthroughs are going to help you. There is some spoiler free information that is useful if you don't intend on playing 100% blind (some people prefer playing 100%) blind.I don't use Dsfix because I read that the latest patches screw things up. Apparently the publisher is against it being used. It looks like there's a new update for Dsfix and it's working again. There's also a comment that says that DSfix wasn't intended to be one of the mods taken down. There is a mod that is supposed make dark souls 1 easier with a mouse and keyboardhttp://www.nexusmods.com/darksouls/mods/28/?I've been playing online partially because I didn't know how to play it offline and when I looked it up it sounded like if you do it wrong you won't be able to save. Yesterday I was getting a message that the game wasn't syncing and one of the fixes was to close the steam client which also is one way you can play offline. So that's the only way I know how. Otherwise it might involve configuring GFWL.There are advantages to playing online. One is that there are in game messages left by players that often give hints. Most are somewhat helpful, but there are a few troll messages like saying "try jumping" next to an edge of a cliff or fake invisible walls (there are some real ones you likely won't find without a tip unless you check every wall). Also messages saying things like "try but hole" or "tongue but hole". As you can guess there is a limited amount of words and phrases you can use to prevent things like the above.The bosses are very tough so being able to summon players is very useful for playing online. You can still sometimes summon NPCs for bosses, but only certain bosses and under certain conditions. There's also npc invaders, but they're not anywhere as tough as players. And after you beat them you're often able to summon them for bosses. Bosses do have more health if you summon someone so be aware of that.In Dark Souls (but not Dark Souls 2) you can only summon or be invaded if you're in human form so it's pretty easy to avoid invasions unless you want to do co-op. The only other time it's useful to go human is to kindle bonfires which isn't very often.

content:
Posted: April 24, 2015
												Excellent game. I have enjoyed every hour (except those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ archers in Anor Londo) playing this game, almost every minute on the edge wondering what was gonna come around the next corner to take me out. I love the lore with this game in the sense you can theorize on a lot of things with other players in the community to piece the story or history behind the characters and environment. Sound is amazing with gripping parts in perfect moments and the voice actors are fantastic, especially at showing how the curse is slowly affecting them as you meet them thru the game. Graphics are not bad, especially if you do a nice mod on the textures, the game can look pretty damn amazing. Gameplay is really good as well, but i do not care for the platforming aspect of the game at all. As long as you are careful you will be ok but there will be times when you may just fall, or have some pretty terrible luck, inducing some good old fashion rage if you had a good chunk of souls or humanity on you. Spends souls wisely, but dont walk around with moneybags on your waist full of the stuff or you will seriously regret it if you die and then dont make it back to your bloodstain. This game is definitely not for everyone, and i can definitely agree as i did not care for the series at all. I am now hooked, weirdly playing them in reverse order, but still enjoying it nonetheless. I strongly recommend this game to anyone who wants a serious challenge with a good feeling of triumph and satisfaction when you topple that tough boss or pass thru that dungeon that handed you your♥♥♥♥♥a few times over.     Rating:   9.5/10!

content:
Posted: March 24, 2016
												Definately the best RPG trilogy out there, and now that the third one is coming along with Hidetaka Miyazaki directing it. I strongly  suggest that you start your journey without spoiling yourself about literally anything!, thats the beauty of it!, going at it with barely any info on the game and you slowly start to learn and discover the world with some of the most impressive level designs I've seen. Yes you will suffer alot, but know this, there is no artificial difficulty here, simply your thinking and how you will over come the tasks ahead. Whoever says the game is too difficult are simply not playing it right, surely there are no tutorials that pop up in your face every five minutes, so you'll have to learn most of the the mechanics on your own. This game will change the way you look at bosses and how you fight them, and the euphoric moment when you overcome a boss/challenge you couldn't accomplish before is fantastic. Great gameplay mechanics and a beautiful deep story in a gorgeous world with lovely/hateful characters with their own stories to tell. 9.7/10 probably the best game I've ever played,and I don't think anything can top this series.GO ON AND PLAY IT!

content:
Posted: January 7, 2014
												Get ready for the challenge of a lifetime. Things like slaying a demon in the abyss and fighting a horde of giants is your ordinary day with Dark Souls. Its more than an adventure. Its more than an RPG. Its a test of endurance and skill that can set any casual gamer at unease. Fear not, the game sticks to you, and you wont stop until youve beaten it. The variety of weapons and class making makes it an unique experience that you would want to repeat with different classes and weapons. The PC port is horrible and I suggest that you get an Xbox 360 controller and its adapter for PC. Trust me, it is so worth it even if you will never use that controller again. The game forces you to learn and progress, making each victory feel like an accomplishment for you. I'll give it a 9/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2013
												Dark Souls is one of the most engaging games I've ever played.It's a dark melee focused RPG with magic elements and difficult 3rd person startegic combat.Let me start this off with stating the 'not so good' things first to leave you with a good taste in your mouth as this game is 100% worth buying.- The "Not so Good" elements{1} There are a few areas in the game that are not that plesant to go through at first. Once you get familair with the layout it's OK but they seem rather annoying for no real reason. There's an area that has pretty much complete darkness and if you don't have an item that creates light you're in for a bad time.Another place is rather maze-like and has annyoing enemies which shoot poison at you from afar, across bridges and plateaus. Once you know your way around the area it's not an issue and the enemies can be killed using ranged attacks (they don't respawn).{2} Another thing is that this game for PC pretty much requires 2 mods (I would say these actually are unofficial patches since they fix the game for you instead of add anything). These files are:http://blog.metaclassofnil.com/?tag=dsfix (Durante's DSfix) - this will unlock the framerate for you to 60 FPS (if you wish) and will make the scaled-up graphics look like they should have had on release.{3} The other patch i'd recommend is the DSMfix (Dark Souls Mouse fix) http://pages.cs.wisc.edu/~petska/this will make your mouse movements more smooth and allows for proper manual aim with the bows. It also allows you to rebind the mouse keys.{4} The interface is very clumsy initially. You get used to it rather quickly after you've been playing for a bit but everything is kind of hidden around the whole inventory/stats UI. There's a keybind that allows you to ask for information around each element of it but that is also rather hidden :D I recommend to check out the keybind options before you start playing. Note that this is also really wierd, you get more options for the keybinds In-Game than you do at the start menu so be sure to check that out after making a character.- The 'Yay/Nah" elementsPersonally I love these mechanics but I can understand that some people find them frustrating.(1) The game has some very confusing multiplayer aspects that require you to meet some in-game criteria in order to function.This can make it dififcult to play the game Co-Op since you must meet them.For a full read on them you can check this website: http://darksoulswiki.wikispaces.com/Online(2) There are secrets in the game that you probably wouldn't know about if you didn't read the wiki or if nobody pointed the out to you. As a result the game can seem unfair since it is already rather punishing but if you don't know where that other checkpoint is because of an invisible wall it can seem even more harsh. Luckily this is remedied in-game for the most part, since other players can leave you readable text signs on the ground to indicate 'Hey, there' a secret room here! Hit this wall!" or "Watch out for the trap ahead!". They're pre-defined text messages so they can't walk you through the whole thing but they can leave nice litle clues behind for you to make things more managable.(3) The game gives you a feeling of open-world though it kind of isn't per-say. It wants you to follow a specific route in order to progress but it does so in an open environment. Sure you can go down this road but you're gonna get your♥♥♥♥♥kicked by strong enemies - the upside to this is you can find better equipment in that area so if you do manage to blaze through it you'll be in a good spot for later. This also allows for a high replayabillity but i'll get to that in 'The Good' part of this review.(4) You're thrown into the world without a single damn clue - the game very much doesn't tell you jack upfront, but it tries to teach you 'the hard way'. The tutorial area already makes this apparent since it throws you into a big room with a strong guy, from which you are supposed to run away from (aka - pick your fights). It throws a trap at you that you seemingly couldn't have noticed (you could have from far away but you probably wouldn't have) which is a way of telling you to - watch out for the environment and progress slowly. I very much like this way of teaching you the game though if you don't 'get' the lesson then you're gonna be in for a hard time.- The "Good" elements I can write a whole blog about this but i'll stick to my top 5 or nobody is gonna read it :D[1] Every setup is viable! What I mean by this is that you're able to play this game the way YOU want, and it is going to work out. There's a great balance between difficulty for each approach. Some areas can be a bit harder if you play a light-weight fast-combat rogue-like character, but there's another area that will make things easier with that approach. Similairly if you play a pyromancer you'll get an easier start but things can be a bit more tricky in the parts where you have longer times in-between checkpoints (since your magic runs out after a few charges). The combat is awesome and versatile with every setup you play and there's litteraly a stormload of weapons, magics and gear to be found that all act in a different way. Halberd #1 can do other moves than Halberd #2. You can also upgrade your weapons and gear to make them add burn damage or lightning damage, bless them to make them holy and deal more damage to skeletons and undead or simply use that poisonous herb you found laying around to soak your blade in a temporarily poison debuff. [2] The game has amazing replayability. If you ""end"" the game you'll go right back at it in a NG+ mode, which increases the difficulty by making enemies tougher and hit harder, but you get to keep everything you had that is not story/quest related (aka armor/weapons/magic/items). Also - you're unable to get everything in the game with just 1 playthrough, you're going to need to do multiple runs if you wish to aquire everything the game has to offer. Since the game is not linair you can simply go to a different area to start out NG+ so you won't 'run the threadmill' but get a nice change of pace.[3] The PvP in this game is godlike (even though GFWL is terrible, once it works its brilliant). It's very interesting to see the matches you get against other players that invade your world - test your combat skills against an enemy that could have done the exact same setup, but probably didn't. The PvP is unlike anything you've played before and I'd highly recommend doing it once you've had your hands on the game for a bit. Note that the PvP engagements are strangely done once more (much like every multiplayer aspect of this game - which makes it interesting) I advice you to read the dark souls wiki if you plan on going toe-to-toe with others. Or you could simply team-up with a co-op partner and play the game that way![4] The story. While it is a bit hidden and tucked away, there's so many elements that fit together if you pay attention and take an interest in what you find (read the descriptions on items, notice where you found them, notice what is around the area you found them, notice what NPC's told you about certain locations/items/people). The game very much believes you are 'part of the experience' as in -your character already knows about what's going on and as such they dont explicity tell you why certain things happen. As you play you start to realise what's going on and that feeling of being in the unknown fades slowly as you progress.[5] The community. There's a lot of people who play this game and you encounter them in different ways while you progress yourself. People will leave you clues, they might leave a summoning sign so you can summon them to your world in order to help you out with a difficult area or you could start a friendly duel with them via another summoning method.TLDR: BUY THIS GAME - IT'S AMAZING.

content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												One of my favorite games of all time. It doesn't hold your hand and doesn't even tell you the whole story. Through the descriptive text on items, optional dialogue with NPCs and paying attention to your surroundings, the story unfolds as much as you want it to. There are so many different ways to develop your character and various roles you can play throughout the storyline. Even the ending is fairly ambiguous. Dark Souls can be quite a challenge but every obstacle can be overcome if you pay attention to what the patterns are. Trial and error also will come into play. If you absolutely hate to lose and get enraged at not being able to figure something out you may want to skip this. But there's a certain level of satisfaction with making progress in this game and all the combat seems so real because the weapons actually appear to have weight behind them.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2013
												If you have masochistic tendencies or find that your confidence in your gaming ability is just a little too high and needs a dashing, you should buy this game. If you enjoy spending hours on a character to realise you have created a terrible build and must start over from scratch, you should buy this game. If you enjoy yelling at a group of pixels on your computer and cursing Japanese game developers, you should buy this game. If you enjoy downloading half a dozen mods to make your game pretty enough to be able to even show it's face among games such as Bioshock Infinite or the Crysis series , you should buy this game. If you want to spend another $30 buying an Xbox 360 Controller to deal with the fact that this is terrible port that doesn't even explain in game keyboard and mouse controls, you should buy this game.HOWEVER...If you enjoy a sense of accomplishment when you play a game, a sense of learning, a lack of babying, some general respect from developers, and heart pounding adrenalin when you finally kill a boss after an hour and a half of consecutive tries (only to learn that this boss is "ez-pz" and the worst is yet to come) that you always have room to grow and room to learn, that there are dozens of different builds and play styles allowing for many hours of repeated play, you should buy this game. If you want a challenge, BUY this game. It will not be easy at first and you will die a lot (the title should give this away...) A Dark Souls veteran told me that if you realise when you die, it's because you suck and not that the game is hard, and that you must learn - it will be one of the more enjoyable and fulfilling games you can buy. If you're still not convinced like I wasn't, but it on sale. If you are a casual, do not buy this game - or do, I heard From Software feed on the tears of weak-willed gamers anyway.

												"Dark Souls" is challenging yet highly rewarding when the challenges are overcome. The land of Lordran is a fantastic and beautiful world with a rich story driven by the sparse dialogue and lore hidden in item descriptions. Unfortunately, the PC version was a first attempt at PC games for From Software and, as such, a few elements suffered. The modding community made quick fixes of all the problems, however, and all are readily available at the Dark Souls Nexus. (http://www.nexusmods.com/darksouls/) [DSfix is a must and I highly recommend the High-Res UI and Subtitle fonts, ORIGINAL - PlayStation3 button icon textures (if you are using a PS3 controller with MotionInJoy), and Lowest Common Denominator HD Textures!]"Dark Souls" on PC does have a problem with other players utilizing hacks and trainers as well as requiring Games for Windows Live to play online. If those two issues are a deal-breaker then pick up the PS3 version (or Xbox360 edition if you are homosexual... "not that there's anything wrong with that").Some people do use a mouse and keyboard to play this game, but a controller of some sort makes gameplay much better in my estimation. It is one of the few games where the mouse and keyboard really give no advantage. Xbox controllers work natively and PS3 controllers can be used via a program called MotionInJoy.Definitely one of my favorite games of the past decade; I highly recommend this game. Also, do yourself a favor and LOOK UP NOTHING. Play the game blind, at least for your first run.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												This game is probably on of the hardest games I've played in a while. It will make you rip your hair out and want to shut off your computer. Dark Souls forces you to pay FULL attention to everything you do in the game. Any lapse in focus will result in the loss of health, or more likely, death. Every enemy you face in the game is a challenge and requires strategy in order to beat. Luckily, you are able to summon other players in game that can help you during the harder boss fights. Unfortunately, you also open yourself up to "Invaders" who are players that come into your game with the sole purpose to rip you a new♥♥♥♥♥hole. I must admit, the first time it happened, I yelled at my screen "WHY ARE YOU SO MEAN!?", as the Invader killed me, sending me back through hours of work... but I digress. The enemy designs in this game are a breath of fresh air and a great change of pace. There are so many different enemy designs which are memorable and inspired. Another thing I love about Dark Souls, is the level of free reign and depth to the game. There are many different side quests which you can follow instead of following the main story line. The combat system in the game is very fun, yet difficult, to use. There are enough different weapons in the game to make your head spin. From claymores to halbreds, or even a pretty in depth magic system, you can pretty much get through the game with almost any weapon you want. It's not so much the power of the weapon, but the skill level of your character and the skill level of the gamer. You can have a huge♥♥♥♥♥sword with 900 power, but if your hero has the strenth of a 5-year-old, your hero will stumble as they try to swing the weapon.Dark Souls is by far one of my favorite games of all time. All of the different systems, weapons, and enemies, will make any playthrough fun and enjoyable. It also doesn't hold your hand like many games today. It drops you into hell and says "Do it ♥♥♥♥♥!", forcing you to learn and become good at the game by yourself. I'd DEFINITELY recomend this game. 9/10~~~NOTE~~~~~- An Xbox game pad or equivalent is basically a MUST- Download the graphical patches for PC to get the most out of the graphics

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												DARK SOULS PREPARE TO DIE	this game right here, is a work of art and beauty, in both terms of gameplay and atmosphere of the world, after owning a total of 3 copies of the game, multiple playthroughs and spending a combined time of 532 hours on it (80 something on PC and 452 on PS3) I finally feel confident to sum up my oppinions and explain why you should play Dark Souls.you play as the chosen undead, the warrior with enougth courage, determination and skill to bring an end to the curse of the undead, as the chosen undead you will travel the dark, teryfying landscapes of Lordran, you will fight deamons and monsters that will decorate your very nightmares, you will face chalenges that will seem imposible, but you will eventually suceed and the sense of acomplishment that you will feel is greater than that of any other game I've ever played. People often mistakenly criticize or praise Dark Souls for how difficult it is, and they are right the first time you play Dark Souls it is difficult, assuming your not a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥noob using a guide. but the game makes you learn from your mistakes, you get eaten by a treasure chest, you go back to the chest and beat the ever living♥♥♥♥♥♥out of it with your sword. like batman's father said "why do we fall down? so that we can learn to pick ourselves up" and that sums up the dificulty of Dark Souls, but still there are some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t moments where the game kills you and you have no idea that was going to happen unless you already know (seath the scaless, I'm talking about you)now the gameplay of Dark Souls is probably my favourite aspect of the game, depending on your choices of gear the game plays out incredibly differently. for instance a big strong warrior clad in huge metal armour and weilding a sword that makes giants soil themselves, is going to feel like a tank, it's strong, it can take a hell of a lot of hits but it's slow, susceptical to backstabs and ripostes. whilst a warrior wearing light armour and wielding a rapier or a dagger etc, is able to flip around the battlefield avoiding getting hit as well as dealing major damage due to back stabs.and all that is just a fraction of what you can create yourself to be, I haven't even covered sorceries, pyromancies, miracles.the great thing about the gameplay is that it's fun, it can be frustrating as hell at times, and people who view bigger numbers as better are gonna have a hard time, you have to build a character that you enjoy playing, with a move set you enjoy. for instance my current build utilizes the Black Knight Great Axe (BKGA) the BKGA does a hell of a lot of damage and can kill almost everything in a couple of swings, but it's heavy, really really heavy. so I combine the axe with some decent armour that has great defence to weight ratio and use a few rings to make my character have a higher equip load and then I'm able to move fast and strike hard, this however can be dangerous because I'm classed as a "glass cannon" I do a lot of damage but I will most likely die if I mess up, so you can see the posibilities Dark Souls has for PvP, PvP can be extremely fun and chalenging when it works, there are quite a lot of hackers online and a♥♥♥♥♥♥ton of plebs with no skill that rely on tactics such as 3 vs 1. another problem with Dark Souls PvP is that the net code that from uses is a piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥ and games for windows live is the worst atrocity I've ever had the privelage to use. to fix from softwares horible coding I heavilly and highly recomend you install both DSFIX and DSCFIX (both of which can be found on the Dark Souls Nexus) both of those mods will fix a lot of problems with Dark Souls.now moving away from PvP I'd like to tell you how great the enviroments for Dark Souls are, the Art Direction for the game is phenomonal, granted the graphics aren't the greatest but by god the Art Direction is almost godly, every area feels diffrent and unique, every area has a diffrent tone and presents you with different obstacles.take the undead asylum (the area you first start in) the asylum has a sense of decay and looks ruined as you walk down the first corridor, you see the tortured minds of the undead around you, they see you as another poor soul trapped for eternity, but your quest has only just beguna good contrast to the asylum is the forest (Dark Wood something I think) the forrest is filled with mystery and danger, at any second a plant like monster can spurt out of the ground and destroy you. the atmospere of the forest is cold and dark with many ledges and many traps.the music is also very eerie at times and adds imensly to the game, it's the sort of soundtrack that fits in so well with the game you forget it's even there, boss fights sound epic and dangerous and exploring feels unsafe and eerieAll in All I highly recomend Dark Souls to everyone, it is by far one of if not my favourite game of the last generation, it has endless fun and a lot of great experiences, the game presents a chalenge and in this day and age of gaming that is very welcome. I will stress that the game does require a game pad, even with all the fixes it still feels horible with keyboard and mouse, I can't wait for Dark Souls 2. so go and buy it and Prepare to die.10/10 pretty gudP.S don't be a ♥♥♥♥♥ and use a guide,P.S.S the drake sword is for the ♥♥♥♥♥es ♥♥♥♥♥(no spell check on steam, don't know if I spelt everything right)

content:
Posted: January 12, 2014
												Dark Souls is an amazing game orginally released for the PS3 and Xbox 360. This port includes the Artorias of the Abyss DLC released later for console versions. Its an action adventure/RPG with a cruel difficulty for new players.That being said, this game is one of my all time favorite games, its challenging but not unfair as you will die and learn from your mistakes. Once you learn the mechanics and controls well enough the game is only moderately difficult but almost never easy. The PC version has some drawbacks, being that you have to download DSFix in order to change the resolution of the game. This game is also strongly recommended with a game pad or Xbox 360 controller.Despite the few flaws in the game, its definately a favorite, and I for one cannot wait for Dark Souls II in March!I give this game 9/10 potato chips!

content:
Posted: November 29, 2013
												If I had to describe Dark Souls in 1 word it would most likely be "rewarding". Beating a single enemy in a game has never felt as great as it did in Dark Souls. The game is hard, unforgiving and at some parts just unfair. But why do people, including myself, still love this game? The answer is that every step, every kill, every boss you take on feels incredibly rewarding once you make it and like something you really worked for to achieve. And this is a feeling that no Skyrim, no Risen 2 or any other game can give you. This combined with the great and challenging Battle system makes for a fantastic experience once one got the hang of it. The only thing one has to keep in mind is that this game can be frustrating, due to the really poor porting on PC. I highly recommend checking for community patches before playing and never ever use keyboard and mouse. This game needs a controller to be played. If you are willing to dig into a deep and dark world full of dangers, then Dark Souls is the game for you.

												there has never been a more accuarate titel for a game, than "prepare to die" for dark souls. this game is unforgiving, cruel and i guarantee you, you will have times, when you want to throw your pc against a wall. but it is also the most rewarding game i ever played. this brief moment after you beat a boss, that whiped you numerous times, is better than having sex. trust me. i had sex once!there are a couple of issues. it is possible to play it with keyboard and mouse, but it requires a bit of tweaking. you need external programs to get it running, but once you got them, it is absolutely playable. of course you could still use a controller, that is fully supported.the atmosphere of dark souls is great, the combat is great, the world is great. the only thing i didnt find quite satisfying is the pvp aspect of the game. but the single player component is one of the best i ever played. don't confuse this game with a hack and slay like diablo. every combat requires a certain tactic, especially the bossfights, wich are tough, tough, tough. but even the trashmobs are always dangerous. so buy this game and prepare to die. you will die a lot. i promise.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 28, 2014
												I can't even begin to describe how good this game is, but, i'll try.Basically, it has everything a gamer could possibly want:-It's challenging to the point of frustration (which only makes winning more satisfying)-It has a large array of gear and loot to keep the collectors and completionists busy for a long while-It has a very in depth, delicate and extremely profound and complicated storyline and lore-Your character has a number of different attributes with a number of different combat paths to take-The combat system is one of the best i've seen in a long while, and while it is hard it is very fun to learn-Almost every weapon has its own unique fighting style-It has Co-op-It has PvP-It has Shops and NPC's and sub-plots of different characters woven into the main storyAll in all, this game is almost flawless. But be warned, the learning curve for the first 10 or so hours of gameplay can be unforgiving, so if you do intend on playing this game, make sure that you have cleared your calendar so you can get to the more enjoyable parts of the game. And if you get stuck, try to think outside the box, or just look it up. Some parts are so complex you can be left wondering how anyone ever figured them out at all. It's small wonder that this game was put in the top 20 games ever. I would recommend that everyone play at least the first 3 or 4 bosses of this game to get the true feel of it. It is utterly fantastic.Also, if you figure out how, SAVE SOLAIRE. He is a true bro.

content:
Posted: March 23, 2014
												This review is written for people who have played the original for PS3/ XBOX, and are thinking about conquering it for PC as well.----------------------------------------------------->I have recently completed over 100 hours on this version, and I had a blast. After programming the DSFix mod (which you will need, and it's easy to do), the game opened up a whole new volley of excitement for me. At 55 FPS I felt like Neo at the end of the first Matrix, just owning everything I came across. So if your coming over from PS3 or XBOX; Parry, Repost, and Back Stabs are much easier at 55 fps... and Blight Town can actually be appreciated.The downside is that the community is smaller, so there isn't as much activity in the multiplayer aspect. Also, with GFWL shutting down soon, Dark Souls "may" become a single player experience. Which will not be so bad for new comers, but for the veterans... that will be most unpleasant. However for now you can use DSCFix, which makes it easier to connect to people.Important NOTES: From "my" experience, the DSFix mod does not help for PCs using native graphics. You need a dedicated GPU, and or video card. I shelled out $150 on my NVIDIA GeForce GTX 650, and it runs so smooth. You Will Need-------------------------------------->A game controler (360 or equivelent)DSFix For frame rate and other graphical settingshttp://www.nexusmods.com/darksouls/mods/19/?DSCFix For online conectivity with other playershttp://www.nexusmods.com/darksouls/mods/334/?----------------------------------------------------------->A Note On My credability: I have already scored 400+ hours, and aquired the platinum for the PS3 version of Dark Souls before playing the PC version, (PSN: Liam_Eibach).

												Dark Souls is an experience missing in most current games. Most likely one of the few things you will have heard about the game is that it is difficult and that you will die. While this is true, it does so for a greater purpose than difficulty’s sake. The story and the world end up being the something that is hard to find elsewhere, and this is reinforced by the difficulty. It is one of a few games where the narrative and the game mechanics work in tandem to create an overall more full experience. If you want a game to treat you like an adult and show a different take on games, than dark souls is worth trying.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												Don't let the "Dark Souls is hard" hype scare you away. There's a few different types of difficulty in games: the kind that tests your skill and dexterity with the controller, the kind that tests your brain and makes you figure things out, and the "arcade hard" that just screws you over randomly and takes your money. Dark Souls is the perfect balance of all three, so even if you're not very good at hard games (like me), the design and balance makes it accessible to anyone who's willing to get in the right "mode" and put in the effort.Every combat encounter requires some strategizing, some practice, and a little bit of luck. It is punishing, you lose "souls" and "humanity" whenever you die, but you do have a chance to get it back, and if it's gone forever, it's not the end of the world. Just accept your losses and, if you can't bring yourself to try that path again, there's usually some other nook to explore in this game's well-designed and wonderful looking world. And stuff will occasionally come out of nowhere and kill you randomly, which if you're in the right mindset just makes the game more hilarious and enjoyable.This game is well worth playing. If you're willing to take it slow, learn the tricks, and trudge your way through, you'll discover a varied and wonderful-looking world with many excellent surprises, some of which throw you off a cliff.

content:
Posted: February 25, 2016
												Dark Souls is an action RPG that originally came out on the PS3 back in 2011 and later ported to PC. In order to get the best experience out of it you'll need to get DSfix and use that (nexus mods has it or just google it). You'll also need a controller. Keyboard & Mouse controls are absolute garbage and even customizing them is worthless.  It's a game that's most famous for it's challenge, although fair, takes skill and trial & error to complete. There's many different playstyles to start from, Warrior, Pyromancer, Sorceror, Cleric etc. With all types of weapons ranging from swords, clubs, hammers, axes, spells, bows, crossbows and so on. As you progress in the game you will find bonfires that you can use to level up your character with souls collected from fallen foes. Bonfires are by far the most useful object in the game. They're needed to repair weapons & armor, store your items, level up and eventually fast travel. Everytime you use a bonfire though all the enemies (except bosses and important monsters) will respawn which means you'll have to plan your route and battle strategy accordingly since distance between bonfires can be quite far.It's not a game I'd call frustratingly hard but it is fair and will punish you for every mistake. Every encounter serves a purpose and the level design which at times can be a bit confusing but still brilliantly constructed to tie the world together is one of my favorite things about the game. The story isn't straightforward and the world building & lore is done mostly through reading item descriptions. If you head into a direction and the enemies totally destroy you, that's the game's way of telling you not to go that way yet.All in all, this game is one of my favorites. Get Dark Souls. Get good.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2014
												Reviewing this game purely on it's merits as a game and not a PC port, it's fantastic, easily one of my favorite games of all time, possibly my favorite RPG of all time. With one of the best combat systems of any game, you make a mistake, you'll probably end up dying, it's extremely punishing and thus not for everyone but if you put in the time it's VERY rewarding.The world and level design is in my opinion unmatched in any RPG, there's all sorts of secrets to be found in the game by jumping from ledges and rolling onto different platforms to get to secret areas, the game is rife with secrets.The story is incredibly deep, complex and compelling but is told subtly in item descriptions, random observations around the world and NPC dialogue.PvP is great fun but likely will be laggy, it's entirely optional, as is CO-OP, some people love to play the game with friends, some love to solo it, I'm in the latter category but there is something here for everyone.The enemy design and voice acting are top notch, I honestly cannot say enough good things about this game, but I stress, if you do not enjoy a challenge (that's fine) then Dark Souls is likely not for you, oh, and the PC port is a barebones straight console port, but is easily fixed by using Durante's "DSFix" Mod.In my opinion, one of the greatest games ever made.

content:
Posted: December 2, 2016
												Dark Souls is definitely a game of great difficulty for a player who is not well prepared or familiar with the game. The game offers a very interesting storyline packed with lore and incredible detail as well as an addictive urge to come back for more. In all likelihood, most of your first playthrough of the game will be spent learning and questioning where you have gone wrong but usually its the simple mistakes the game tricks you into making.  Majority of the time will also be spent screaming and raging at the countless amount of deaths you'll be facing, as death is inevitable with this game (YOU DIED). Dark Souls becomes less difficult once you become familiar with the games concept, item locations and build combinations. Either way it will always provide you with a decent challenge so dont expect any less! The game was created as a masterpiece overall and it deserves all the praise and reputation it has. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who awaits a challenge, loves a story driven adventure and has the time to sink a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of hours into it!Dark Souls 1 in my opinion is the best of the the 3 due to its amazing lore, gameplay and the land of Lordran as its simply stunning. Also mentioning the amazing DLC which easily stands out as the best dlc of the franchise. Out of the 3 it is the game i can get to ng ++++ and still look forward to more and more gameplay. Bandai Namco should be proud of what they created because i know i am as well as thousands of others.   I give the game a 9.9 out of 10 for all reasons listed above, so dont hesitate to buy it! Oh and dont forget to always praise the sun!
